channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why weak jobs data means investors should cut back bets on big U.S. tech names
item.description: The Fed cutting rates tends to see the equalweighted S&P 500 outperform says Jefferies

item.title: ‘I have never been asked for money before’: My friend wants to borrow $1,600 to pay her rent. Do I say yes?
item.description: “I have heard mixed reviews on lending people money.”

item.title: ‘I told him that wouldn’t fly’: My 90-year-old mother’s adviser pushed her to change her beneficiaries. What is going on?
item.description: “He said, ‘I’m just trying to help.’”

item.title: ‘The sky has not fallen — yet’: Is it time to start worrying about a U.S. recession (again)?
item.description: GDP rose by 3% in the second quarter, but the economy added just 73,000 new jobs in July.

item.title: ‘I’m scared to lose too much in risky investments’: I have $140K in a 401(k) and earn $45K a year. Can I retire in 20 years?
item.description: “My 401(k) retirement planner shows I’ll likely be short $1,500 every month during my retirement.”

item.title: Drone swarms: How they actually work and what industries should care
item.description: Drone swarms are distinguished by their decentralized behavior, which offers agility and cost savings for a range of applications. The post Drone swar...

item.title: Why tomorrow’s best devs won’t just code — they’ll curate, coordinate and command AI
item.description: AI coding requires a serious structural change. Where does that leave entry-level developers and the software industry as a whole?

item.title: Beyond the assembly line — swarm robotics emerge
item.description: Swarm robotics, as described in a recent patent for a lighter-than-air aircraft assembly, promises to change manufacturing and design. The post Beyond...

item.title: New vision model from Cohere runs on two GPUs, beats top-tier VLMs on visual tasks
item.description: Cohere's Command A Vision can read graphs and PDFs to make enterprise research richer and analyze the documents businesses actually rely on.

item.title: Google releases Olympiad medal-winning Gemini 2.5 ‘Deep Think’ AI publicly — but there’s a catch…
item.description: The Gemini 2.5 Deep Think released to users is not that same competition model, rather, a lower performing but apparently faster version.

item.title: Why open-source AI became an American national priority
item.description: To reflect democratic principles, AI must be built in the open. If the U.S. wants to lead the AI race, it must lead the open-source AI race.
